title: [K-12] English Learning Design Utilizing Mobile Technology Based on Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English communication skills and fundamental smart device usage
context.additional_context: Self-directed pre-learning using AI chat tools, video platforms, and language learning apps, followed by discussion- and practice-centered face-to-face classes

learning_goals: Learners can analyze pre-learning content and summarize core concepts at least three times per week using mobile technologies (ChatGPT, YouTube, etc.)
Learners can complete English writing/translation assignments incorporating at least two peer feedback sessions using mobile device-based collaboration tools (English Club, etc.)
Learners can identify at least three technical/psychological barriers to mobile technology use in flipped learning environments and propose solutions
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
